p: The H protein of SSPE strains is often mutated as well and contributes to neurovirulence [ 128]. In a recent study, three mutations were found in the H gene of South African SSPE strain, in the cytoplasmic tail, the stalk domain, and Î²5 blade of the head domain, associated with substitutions R7Q, R62Q, and D530E, respectively [ 40]. The residue D530 is necessary for cell entry through SLAM, so the mutation D530E could compromise the use of infection through SLAM [ 129, 130].
